text: Ann Bradford Davis (May 3, 1926 - June 1, 2014) was an American movie, stage, voice, and television actress. She was known for her role as Alice Nelson, the housekeeper in The Brady Bunch. Her career began in 1953. She retired in 1997. She won two Emmy Awards in 1957 and in 1959. Davis was born on May 3, 1926 in Schenectady, New York.Ann B. Davis Archive of American Television Interview She moved to Erie, Pennsylvania when she was three. She studied at Strong Vincent High School and at the University of Michigan. Davis died on June 1, 2014 in San Antonio, Texas from complications from a fall, aged 88. ==References== ==Other websites== * * * Category:1926 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Accidental deaths from falls in the United States Category:Actors from New York (state) Category:Actors from Pennsylvania Category:American movie actors Category:American stage actors Category:American television actors Category:American voice actors Category:Emmy Award winning actors Category:People from Erie, Pennsylvania Category:People from Schenectady, New York Category:Twin people from the United States
title: Ann B. Davis
